Title: Lagos APC slams Obi’s criticism of FG’s national honour policy
Summary: Lagos State chapter of the All Progressives Congress slams Peter Obi's criticism of the Federal Government’s national honours policy . Obi had questioned the federal government's national honour policy . The former Anambra State Governor and Labour Party presidential candidate in the 2023 elections, Peter Obi .

Title: Nurses have suspended strike — Health Minister
Summary: The National Association of Nigerian Nurses and Midwives (NANNM) has suspended its warning strike . Nurses have suspended their warning strike following a closed-door meeting with the Minister of Health, Muhammad Ali Pate . Pate, who addressed journalists after the meeting, confirmed that the strike had been suspended .

Title: Tinubu says administration won’t lose focus on cybersecurity
Summary: President Bola Tinubu reaffirmed his administration’s unwavering commitment to cybersecurity . He pledged that the government will continue to protect Nigerians across both digital and physical spaces as it expands the country's digital frontiers . Speaking at the Progressive Digital Media Summit, he said the government won't lose focus on cybersecurity .

Title: Fintiri gifts Falcons coach Madugu house, ₦50m
Summary: Adamawa State Governor, Ahmadu Fintiri, has presented a three-bedroom bungalow and ₦50 million to Super Falcons assistant coach, Justin Madugu, in recognition of his role in the national team's performance at the 2024 Women’s Africa Cup of Nations .

Title: AfDB to join SAPZ groundbreaking ceremony in Oyo Saturday
Summary: The Federal Government and the Oyo State Special Agro-Industrial Processing Zone (SAPZ) will be joined by the African Development Bank for this event . AfDB to join SAPZ groundbreaking ceremony in Oyo Saturday .

Summary: South Africa's deputy president defended himself Friday for failing to declare a gift to his wife of a diamond from a jailed gem dealer . S/Africa’s deputy president caught up in dodgy diamond claim .

Title: Police rescue six abducted law students in Benue
Summary: Benue Police Command said it successfully rescued all six abducted students of the Nigerian Law School, Yola Campus . Benue police command said it rescued the six abducted law students .

Summary: Spokesman for Osun State Governor, Olawale Rasheed, has stated that his principal will not join the African Democratic Congress or align with any interest within the party ahead of the 2026 state elections in the state . Title: Customs set December deadline for full migration to AEO
Summary: The Nigeria Customs Service has announced December 31, 2025, as the deadline for the migration from the current Fast Track Scheme to the Authorised Economic Operator Programme . The move is in furtherance of its commitment to align Nigeria’s trade facilitation procedures with international best practices .
